text: Werner Sombart (January 19, 1863â€“May 18, 1941) was a German economist and sociologist and was an important social scientist to Europe during the early 20th century. == Life and work== Sombart was born in Ermsleben, Harz. He was the son of Anton Ludwig Sombart, a rich liberal politician, industrialist. Werner studied at the universities in Pisa, Berlin, and Rome, learning both law and economics. In 1888, he received his Ph.D. from Berlin.
